New Records: Taijuan Walker is the first Phillies pitcher to allow 13 or more hits without a strikeout since Blix Donnelly on April 28, 1948.
He is the first Phillies pitcher to not record a strikeout while pitching at least six innings since Ben Lively on June 3, 2017.
He is the first Phillies pitcher to allow 13 or more hits since Aaron Harang allowed 14 in five innings on July 1, 2015.
Key Match Events: The Phillies lost 10-0 to the Astros, with Taijuan Walker pitching six innings and allowing 13 hits, six runs, one walk and one home run.
Pre-Game Insights: There are no clear signs that Taijuan Walker is close to turning the corner, and his velocity has not rebounded like everybody hoped.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rob Thomson said that the Phillies need to discuss Walker's future in the rotation, and that they will consider moving him to the bullpen or designating him for assignment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Walker threw 20 first-pitch strikes to 28 Astros hitters, but there was not much swing-and-miss.
Others: Walker is owed $36 million after this season, and the Phillies could designate him for assignment, although they have never taken a hit on a contract like that.
